CatDescriptText: Harry Bluett, public accountant, 233 Cedarhurst Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "I certainly do.  I think that the reason that it will have a bad effect is because the average child should have its mother and father with it 24 hours a day."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harry Bluett, wearing light colored fedora with dark band, eyeglasses, dark knit scarf, and light colored plaid overcoat, standing on Wood Street with Raab Clothing, and Dimlings Candy on Liberty Avenue in background, Downtown
